commit_message:
Remove skipException for volume creation failure

Since Ice367b73303d74c529351d7bd4d9a4e9b1348e07 , the check has been
added when nova-volume(not cinder) was enabled. At the time, we didn't
have enough resources on the gate and made the resource creation
failure as skip.
However that skip might hide configration issues and we have removed
the similar skip code on Ib82fabb1684ee6beaac2a7c45b0b2dc8ec5d6b4c.
There is still the same skip code in Tempest, and this patch removes
it.

Change-Id: Ib1e851a6380b694f7bdaefdf098d73f791111f6d
Closes-Bug: #1401290
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/11/401011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
rest: wait for the  thread pool executor result

Currently we return to wsgi server once all threads have been started
and don't wait for their return.

Keeping running threads not attached to a request make some wsgi server
mad. And also returning 202 when it should 500 doesn't help to debug
application.

Change-Id: I922e0b7d61280ac42b1068afdcafe68fd5835ba8

commit_message:
Revert changes to CephClusterFSID generation

This patch reverts the two commits listed below. There was a problem
with CephClusterFSID generation as it was created by the password
generation code in Mistral in Newton. However, this password generation
didn't work for upgrades as it didn't take into account upgrades and
passwords that were in use in an existing Heat stack.

This issue was resolved in I3ea6bbd0d9c5dd345b8a4a26a1788326e09d4209.
Now when a deployment plan is created, if there is an existing Heat
stack it takes the parameters from the Heat stack and uses those, rather
than regenerating. This change should also resolve the issue where the
CephClusterFSID was regenerated.

Revert "Generate CephClusterFSID for new stacks"
This reverts commit 20167e850a6bcb1fbb1bfa8cb030000600c3dc27.

Revert "Revert "Add CephClusterFSID to generated passwords""
This reverts commit ad64050485f79d2330c68b76a3f21b4c0d9a3e33.

Related-Bug: #1636555
Change-Id: I10b5613eda4bd47554a4f5e9f57218010b835fe7
(cherry picked from commit e1c07fc453e5113782fb0d22cd4a487260f68579)

commit_message:
Update docs around TrivialFix

Following a discussion on the mailing list[0] the community has agreed
there is limited use around enforcing the TrivialFix tag for all commits
that don't warrant a bug.

Update the docs to reflect this.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/106643.html

Closes-Bug: 1641925
Change-Id: If9a73fc767ace681203e9dae8d0c291635060dc9
(cherry picked from commit 870616f8858556e4dc5abb3838259d12c14e0263)

deleted_lines: for any significant bug fix or add a TrivialFix tag for simple changes. See how to reference a bug or a blueprint in the commit message here_ #. TrivialFix tags or bugs are not required for documentation changes.

commit_message:
Use kwargs to pass in data and error to Mistral Result

This standardises how we create mistral.workflow.utils.Result instances.
Previously we used a combination of passing empty strings or None values
to pass errors only. Using kwargs makes this clearer and cleaner. This
is also means we use the Result class in the same way as the builtin
Mistral actions.

Change-Id: Ic94c0513b1fba030de70263ac1df32b4ab130e9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/48/375348/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return mistral_workflow_utils.Result(error=result_string) return mistral_workflow_utils.Result(error=message) return mistral_workflow_utils.Result(error=err_msg)
deleted_lines: return mistral_workflow_utils.Result( None, result_string ) return mistral_workflow_utils.Result(None, message) return mistral_workflow_utils.Result(None, err_msg)

commit_message:
Add tags support in CLI

Releases new fuel2 commands to operate on tags:
fuel2 tag create
fuel2 tag delete
fuel2 tag download
fuel2 tag list
fuel2 tag update

DocImpact

Change-Id: I71ae78b4a733d83a5441ff0ac5ba627502e7f2b3
Implements: blueprint role-decomposition

commit_message:
RBD: improve readability in over provisioning tests

This change doesn't effect behaviour, but makes the tests more readable
as the stats fields are now of the correct type.

commit_message:
Move away from $KEYSTONE_CATALOG_BACKEND

The variable was removed from devstack [1], so our devstack plugin
should move away from it as well. This commit should fix the gate.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391380/

Change-Id: Ice1f066657c6a09f9335d1117bdaebb1e70d483d

added_lines: from fuelclient.cli.actions.base import check_any fields_mapper = ( ('env', 'clusters'), ('release', 'releases') ) group( Args.get_env_arg(), Args.get_release_arg("Release id"), required=True ), def parse_model(self, args): for param, role_class in self.fields_mapper: model_id = getattr(args, param) if model_id: return role_class, model_id @check_any('release', 'env') model, model_id = self.parse_model(params) roles = Role(owner_type=model, owner_id=model_id).data @check_all('role', 'file') @check_any('release', 'env') model, model_id = self.parse_model(params) role = Role(owner_type=model, owner_id=model_id).get_role(params.role) @check_all('file') @check_any('release', 'env') model, model_id = self.parse_model(params) role = Role(owner_type=model, owner_id=model_id).create_role(role) @check_all('file') @check_any('release', 'env') model, model_id = self.parse_model(params) role = Role(owner_type=model, owner_id=model_id).update_role( role['name'], role) @check_all('role') @check_any('release', 'env') model, model_id = self.parse_model(params) Role(owner_type=model, owner_id=model_id).delete_role(params.role)

subject: Make the CloudDomain defaults match the doc strings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 21:02:37.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/compute-role.yaml', 'puppet/cephstorage-role.yaml', 'puppet/role.role.j2.yaml', 'puppet/objectstorage-role.yaml', 'puppet/blockstorage-role.yaml', 'puppet/controller-role.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/0ca8dab4cb2acb2eb3904e4edfbbd33a47fa97a3', 'message': 'Make the CloudDomain defaults match the doc strings

Not having the default easily accessible is causing issues for the UI,
as it cannot guess at it and can accidentally overwrite the value with
an empty string (the expected default when unset). The default is
already helpfully spelled out in the doc string for each file, this
updates the parameter to match it.

Closes-Bug: #1643670
'}]
commit_message:
Make the CloudDomain defaults match the doc strings

Not having the default easily accessible is causing issues for the UI,
as it cannot guess at it and can accidentally overwrite the value with
an empty string (the expected default when unset). The default is
already helpfully spelled out in the doc string for each file, this
updates the parameter to match it.

Change-Id: Ic284f9904e8f1d01cc717d59a0759f679d94106d
Closes-Bug: #1643670

commit_message:
functional test: install acl package

dsvm-functional test fails to run due to lack of setfacl command.
Install acl package that includes setfacl, and set GATE_STACK_USER
which configure_for_func_testing.sh requires.

Change-Id: I4582dae53c660598c1a304f4bd467250431407a1

commit_message:
Start using tripleo-quickstart-extras

Replace the extra role requirements from
quickstart-extras-requirements.txt with a single repository upstream
(tripleo-quickstart-extras) consisting of the merged history of all
previously used roles.

Further changes to these roles are to be submitted to this
tripleo-quickstart-extras repo through review.openstack.org instead of
review.gerrithub.io.

Several role name changes occured during this transition, which this
change also corrects in playbooks hosted within this repository.

Change-Id: I9b532b8f63d68d9791f7403c9d66558f8221d980

commit_message:
Run amphora agent with gunicorn

Flask's default runner (werkzeug) is plagued with bugs.
If we use gunicorn instead, we should have many less problems!

Depends-On: I211dc771aa95147c0f1d9e6ac1a65a7e164b33c2
Change-Id: I59897167f9285bf013f8a155dd2ea4f799ac1d3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/58/386758/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import gunicorn.app.baseimport sixclass AmphoraAgent(gunicorn.app.base.BaseApplication): def __init__(self, app, options=None): self.options = options or {} self.application = app super(AmphoraAgent, self).__init__() def load_config(self): config = dict( [(key, value) for key, value in six.iteritems(self.options) if key in self.cfg.settings and value is not None] for key, value in six.iteritems(config): self.cfg.set(key.lower(), value) def load(self): return self.application health_sender_proc = multiproc.Process(name='HM_sender', target=health_daemon.run_sender, args=(HM_SENDER_CMD_QUEUE,)) health_sender_proc.daemon = True health_sender_proc.start() options = { 'bind': '{host}:{port}'.format( host=CONF.haproxy_amphora.bind_host, port=CONF.haproxy_amphora.bind_port ), 'workers': 1, 'certfile': CONF.amphora_agent.agent_server_cert, 'ca_certs': CONF.amphora_agent.agent_server_ca, 'cert_reqs': True, } AmphoraAgent(server_instance.app, options).run()
deleted_lines: import os import sslfrom werkzeug import serving# Hack: Use werkzeugs context # also http://stackoverflow.com/questions/23262768/ # two-way-ssl-authentication-for-flask class OctaviaSSLContext(serving._SSLContext): def __init__(self, protocol): self._ca_certs = None super(OctaviaSSLContext, self).__init__(protocol) def load_cert_chain(self, certfile, keyfile=None, password=None, ca=None): self._ca_certs = ca super(OctaviaSSLContext, self).load_cert_chain( certfile, keyfile, password) def wrap_socket(self, sock, **kwargs): return super(OctaviaSSLContext, self).wrap_socket( sock, # Comment out for debugging if you want to connect without # a client cert cert_reqs=ssl.CERT_REQUIRED, ca_certs=self._ca_certs # Workaround for an issue with the auto-reload used below in werkzeug # Without it multiple health senders get started when werkzeug reloads if not os.environ.get('WERKZEUG_RUN_MAIN'): health_sender_proc = multiproc.Process(name='HM_sender', target=health_daemon.run_sender, args=(HM_SENDER_CMD_QUEUE,)) health_sender_proc.daemon = True health_sender_proc.start() # We will only enforce that the client cert is from the good authority # todo(german): Watch this space for security improvements ctx = OctaviaSSLContext(ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv23) ctx.load_cert_chain(CONF.amphora_agent.agent_server_cert, ca=CONF.amphora_agent.agent_server_ca) # This will trigger a reload if any files change and # in particular the certificate file serving.run_simple(hostname=CONF.haproxy_amphora.bind_host, port=CONF.haproxy_amphora.bind_port, application=server_instance.app, use_debugger=CONF.debug, ssl_context=ctx, use_reloader=True, extra_files=[CONF.amphora_agent.agent_server_cert])

commit_message:
Added python-monascaclient and Added more doc for Monasca driver

Enrich monasca-driver doc strings and documented un-documented methods
Added missing Monasca client dependency

Change-Id: Ie3dd02e5c70415a4e05d1add19a79de33705b712
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-dr refs/changes/45/401345/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
"""Monasca monitoring driver to monitor compute nodes. It makes use of Monasca to monitor the compute nodes. Metric information needed. 'hostname' must be used in dimensions to filter the values in alarms. You need to define alarms for all hosts with the required metrics.""" self.__load_metrics() """Build the query to send to Monasca""" # @todo(szaher) use list comprehension instead of loops """Process metric values got from Monasca. Handles UNDETERMINED states and changes it to required state(read from config file). If no metric data found,""" You can try this command to check:
def __load_metrics(self): """load custom sections created by user""" """List of options to be used in metric defined sections"""

subject: Run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 11:58:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent/commit/c609565260af07c1c65b6cae292882656b479f5f', 'message': "Run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent

It looks like mcollective is restarted two times duting boot
process. First, it simply restarted by nailgun-agent to change
node's ID. And then it gets restarted by fix-configs-on-startup
after it fixes mcollective's configuration file.

It turns out that such sequence of restarts may cause node's
provisioning problems when node's boot process is delayed. The
simpe workaround is to run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent
instead of simply restarting mcollective.

commit_message:
Run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent

It looks like mcollective is restarted two times duting boot
process. First, it simply restarted by nailgun-agent to change
node's ID. And then it gets restarted by fix-configs-on-startup
after it fixes mcollective's configuration file.

It turns out that such sequence of restarts may cause node's
provisioning problems when node's boot process is delayed. The
simpe workaround is to run fix-configs-on-startup by nailgun-agent
instead of simply restarting mcollective.

Change-Id: I43e1ec46bf145ebcf23d044c7a6f08f2b60542d9
Partial-bug: #1642377
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent refs/changes/59/399559/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: puts `/usr/bin/fix-configs-on-startup`

commit_message:
Glance upgrade testing.

Implement upgrade testing for os_glance role.

This patch adds an upgrade testenv, which configures a previous version
of glance, and the test-vars from the stable/newton branch to be used by
the previous version of glance.

We don't run functional tests after the initial stable/newton deploy
because a working stable/newton branch is already tested, and it's
assumed it worked if the upgrade works too - which is more efficient.

This follows the pattern setup for Keystone in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384269/

Change-Id: I8b2418ffc9197814b0eb85da647916323f9cefd5
Implements: blueprint upgrade-testing
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_glance refs/changes/19/396219/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:upgrade] deps = {[testenv:ansible]deps} setenv = {[testenv]setenv} ANSIBLE_PARAMETERS=-vvv -e glance_upgrade=True commands = {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-functional.sh"

commit_message:
HPE3PAR move mount and copy to m-dat

Use the driver data helper to move the mount and
copy used during create-share-from-snapshot out
of the 3PAR driver and into the data service.

Implements blueprint bp/hp3par-share-server-support
Change-Id: Ie8399f8bc7b4a1e8715be4d771f1059cf6a62c8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/60/335260/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from manila.share import drivers_data_helper hcapacity = hard_size_mb scapacity = soft_size_mb scapacity = max(0, scapacity) hcapacity = max(0, hcapacity) scapacity=six.text_type(scapacity), hcapacity=six.text_type(hcapacity)) if size > 0 and not readonly and not self.hpe3par_fstore_per_share: self._update_capacity_quotas(fstore, size, 0, fpg, vfs) def create_share_from_snapshot(self, context, share_id, share_proto, extra_specs, orig_project_id, orig_share_id, orig_share_instance_id, size=None, ret = self.create_share( readonly=False, size=size, # TODO: admin access? self.allow_access(orig_project_id, share_id, share_proto, extra_specs, 'ip', self.my_ip, 'rw', fpg, vfs) if fstore == orig_share_name: # No subdir for original share created with fstore_per_share sharedir = '.snapshot/%s' % snapshot['snapName'] else: sharedir = '.snapshot/%s/%s' % (snapshot['snapName'], orig_share_name) # self.db.share_export_locations_update( # context, share_id, ret) data_service_helper = drivers_data_helper.DataServiceHelper() data_service_helper.copy_share_data( context, orig_share_instance_id, sharedir, orig_share_instance_id, self.ensure_prefix(share_id) ) return ret if fstore != share_name: # reduce the fsquota by share size when a share is deleted. self._update_capacity_quotas(fstore, 0, share_size, fpg, vfs) if not self.hpe3par_fstore_per_share: self._delete_file_tree(share_name, protocol, fpg, vfs, fstore) def create_super_share(self, share_proto, fpg, vfs, project_id): if self.hpe3par_fstore_per_share: return protocol = self.ensure_supported_protocol(share_proto) fstore = self.ensure_prefix(project_id, protocol) self._create_super_share(protocol, fpg, vfs, fstore) return self._generate_mount_path(protocol, fpg, vfs, fstore) "SUPER_%s" % fstore,
deleted_lines: hcapacity = six.text_type(hard_size_mb) scapacity = six.text_type(soft_size_mb) scapacity=scapacity, hcapacity=hcapacity) if size: self._update_capacity_quotas(fstore, size, 0, fpg, vfs) def create_share_from_snapshot(self, share_id, share_proto, extra_specs, orig_project_id, orig_share_id, if fstore == orig_share_name: # No subdir for original share created with fstore_per_share sharedir = '.snapshot/%s' % snapshot['snapName'] else: sharedir = '.snapshot/%s/%s' % (snapshot['snapName'], orig_share_name) return self.create_share( sharedir=sharedir, readonly=True, if not self.hpe3par_fstore_per_share: self._delete_file_tree(share_name, protocol, fpg, vfs, fstore) if fstore: # reduce the fsquota by share size when a share is deleted. self._update_capacity_quotas(fstore, 0, share_size, fpg, vfs) SUPER_SHARE,

commit_message:
Remove join filter from optional pip module tasks

Ansible 2.2 now treats the 'name' argument for the pip module
as a list, removing the need for us to implement the join
filter to optimise the install execution.

Change-Id: I16d6d75cc432ba57407689d0e1a4055c8172ce12

commit_message:
Remove deprecated ansible_ssh_host variable

This changes 'ansible_ssh_host' to 'ansible_host'. The 'ansible_ssh_host'
variable has been deprecated as noted here: [0].

[0] - http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/intro_inventory.html#hosts-and-groups

commit_message:
devstack: run tests with tempest run command

tempest/tools/pretty_tox_serial.sh is deprecated way and caused test
failure due to version mismatch.
So use tempest run command with tox to run tests.

Change-Id: If896118452e11401723efdab23f044b3e85476ab
Related-bug: #1634940
(cherry picked from commit c0f6114e6d91d6a4ea56c9a3d34fb7be01b400f7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/76/396276/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo -H -u $owner $sudo_env tox -eall -- $DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX --serial

commit_message:
Add Newton repo details

Now that Newton has been released we need to document how to install
it.  This adds the requisite newton admonition and repo setup.

Change-Id: If76abdffde5c1a1959da8422ac5bd4f556c0956e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/36/396736/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. admonition:: Newton :class: newton mton Enable latest RDO Newton Delorean repository for all packages :: sudo curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-newton.repo https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-mitaka/current/delorean.repo Enable the Newton Delorean Deps repository :: sudo curl -L -o /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean-deps-newton.repo http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-mitaka/delorean-deps.repo

subject: Add API for listing all introspection statuses
revisions:

"}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2016-09-21 19:12:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/078ec9064e4309aeb60cb7ecce839bf507ca5c4f', 'message': "Add API for listing all introspection statuses

This patch introduces an API endpoint to list introspection statuses.
It supports filterin on these queries: started_before, started_after,
finished_before, finished_after. The endpoint supports pagination with
an uuid-marker and a limit queries.

In contrast to the RFE bug, the filtering isn't based on the:
finished=None/True/False query.  This option was dropped because it
would be deprecated with filtering based on state once that patch
lands.  Instead, to obtain the list of unfinished introspections, one
can use a finished_after=inf (infinity) query i.e those not finished
yet.  Similarly, to the get list of finished introspections one can
use a finished_before=inf i.e before ethe end of time.

Due to the pagination, this change introduces a new configuration
section: ``[api]`` and the option ``api.max_limit``.

Change-Id: I74d02698801d5290619161b2d8d7181ab51a0a5e
Closes-Bug: #1525238
"}, {'number': 22, 'created': '2016-09-22 06:57:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/60f5b9eaeda1ce6c1a8a3d11b67f6eb94323b895', 'message': "Add API for listing all introspection statuses

This patch introduces an API endpoint to list introspection statuses.
It supports filtering on these queries: started_before, started_after,
finished_before, finished_after. The endpoint supports pagination with
an uuid-marker and a limit queries.

In contrast to the RFE bug, the filtering isn't based on the:
finished=None/True/False query.  This option was dropped because it
would be deprecated with filtering based on state once that patch
lands.  Instead, to obtain the list of unfinished introspections, one
can use a finished_after=inf (infinity) query i.e those not finished
yet.  Similarly, to the get list of finished introspections one can
use a finished_before=inf i.e before ethe end of time.

Due to the pagination, this change introduces a new configuration
section: ``[api]`` and the option ``api.max_limit``.

Change-Id: I74d02698801d5290619161b2d8d7181ab51a0a5e
Closes-Bug: #1525238
"}, {'number': 23, 'created': '2016-10-07 14:14:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/519a447f40878f46944fbb24226ed39fbf29e57b', 'message': 'Add API for listing all introspection statuses

commit_message:
Add API for listing all introspection statuses

This patch introduces an API endpoint to list introspection statuses.  The
endpoint supports pagination with an uuid-marker and a limit query string
fields.  Due to the pagination, this change introduces a new configuration
option: ``api_max_limit``.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I74d02698801d5290619161b2d8d7181ab51a0a5e
Partial-Bug: #1525238
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/21/344921/36 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Add API for listing introspection statuses, operators can get status for all introspection processing running or run previously. Support filtering by 'finished' parameter: * finished = null/absent fetches all statuses * finished = true fetches only finished * finished = false fetches only not finished

commit_message:
Remove the nova_fs alarms

We don't know if there is a dedicated filesystem for /var/lib/nova so we
cannot have alarms for this filesystem.

Change-Id: I3d7f7db02c7a6e1f4228e56ade94da5e88a2681e

commit_message:
Set heat.conf max_nested_stack_depth = 6

The undercloud currently relies on the default
max_nested_stack_depth=5. However the containerised compute change[1]
adds another level of nested stacks. This means that container
developers are manually setting max_nested_stack_depth=6 to deploy a
containerised overcloud.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330659

Change-Id: Ie6dcce9c332c06e2acb889358e08746aec593319
Depends-On: I998f3a1a89ce4bc4c3926a83adec1929addeab24

commit_message:
Introduce tags_metadata file for plugins

'tags_metadata.yaml' file contains set of tags for tasks
serialization. These tags can be used in roles introduced
by the plugin.

Change-Id: I1e68a240b2fe535188404eb47c23b875a4616f2a
Implements: blueprint role-decomposition

commit_message:
Make it clear that removing ironic-inspector.sqlite is for Liberty only

Move this procedure to an admonition, and warn that it's not recommended.

Change-Id: Ie73131528ce5acdb8d9e30480aee9e37fa469b3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/17/377917/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Introspection for a node can be stopped with the following command::.. admonition:: Liberty :class: liberty The ``abort`` command above was introduced in the Mitaka release. For older versions the recommended path is to wait until it times out. Changing ``timeout`` setting in ``/etc/ironic-inspector/inspector.conf`` may be used to reduce the timeout from 1 hour (which usually too much, especially on virtual environments). If you do need to stop introspection **for all nodes** right now on the Liberty release, you can do the following for each node:: ironic node-set-power-state UUID off then remove ironic-inspector cache, rebuild it and restart ironic-inspector:: rm /var/lib/ironic-inspector/inspector.sqlite sudo ironic-inspector-dbsync --config-file /etc/ironic-inspector/inspector.conf upgrade sudo systemctl restart openstack-ironic-inspector Note that this procedure is not recommended and may have unexpected side effects.
deleted_lines: Starting with the Mitaka release, introspection for a node can be stopped with the following command::For older versions the recommended path is to wait until it times out. Changing ``timeout`` setting in ``/etc/ironic-inspector/inspector.conf`` may be used to reduce this timeout from 1 hour (which usually too much, especially on virtual environment). If you do need to stop introspection **for all nodes** right now, do the following for each node:: ironic node-set-power-state UUID off then remove ironic-inspector cache, rebuild it and restart ironic-inspector:: rm /var/lib/ironic-inspector/inspector.sqlite sudo ironic-inspector-dbsync --config-file /etc/ironic-inspector/inspector.conf upgrade sudo systemctl restart openstack-ironic-inspector

commit_message:
Fix devstack plugin compatibility

The devstack mistral compatibility was broken by a recent patch in
devstack. This patch is intended to fix the issue by removing the
dependency on deleted env variables.

Change-Id: I768168fa95f5bc010815af5ff03117edb245137b
Closes-Bug: #1644194

commit_message:
Enable hacking extensions framework

<long rant deleted>

This change enables the hacking extensions ability in trove. That
includes bumping the version of hacking that we use, and also adding
the enable-extensions like in the [flake8] section. I've enabled two
of the hacking extensions here.

There are some limitations to the hacking rules that I've enabled so
I'm also going to enter two bugs that others can fix (if they so
desire).

Change-Id: I6d8fc4bc03f948b84ad823e5248d78a4caa5c042
Related-Bug: 1642554
Related-Bug: 1642552

subject: Avoid redundant validations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 20:52:58.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/3aebdabf2e78ac9e920b9dd8c748c4fad0d723c3', 'message': 'Avoid redundant validations

When multiple resources in a stack have identical definitions, there is no
purpose in re-running validation on every single one. This is a common
occurrence in, for example, autoscaling groups.

By eliminating the need to validate every identical resource, this patch
should help prevent timeouts on create/update with large autoscaling groups
of the kind created by e.g. Magnum.

Change-Id: Iaed5a707a72ae558552d35738db10dc05e5f6343
Closes-Bug: #1644013
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid redundant validations

When multiple resources in a stack have identical definitions, there is no
purpose in re-running validation on every single one. This is a common
occurrence in, for example, autoscaling groups.

By eliminating the need to validate every identical resource, this patch
should help prevent timeouts on create/update with large autoscaling groups
of the kind created by e.g. Magnum.

Change-Id: Iaed5a707a72ae558552d35738db10dc05e5f6343
Closes-Bug: #1644013
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/61/400961/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
clean up developer docs

* remove online_schema_migration_examples since they overlap
  with a section in the best practices doc

* move developer docs to doc/source/devref and rename where
  appropriate

* moved content in developer.rst around, so the more often used
  functions (releasenotes, docs, sample config and tests are
  near the top).

* general clean up

Change-Id: If00b6535564644ff1f5b78e232edbac5d6e686f0

commit_message:
Remove deprecated nova-all binary

This was deprecated and to set to be removed in Ocata. It was only
intended for testing purposes and not for production use. Individual
binaries will be used instead.

Change-Id: I260962ec7c4167b07e9480a04454a9cb5666f8ed

deleted_lines: # Copyright 2011 OpenStack Foundation # Copyright 2010 United States Government as represented by the # Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """Starter script for all nova services. This script attempts to start all the nova services in one process. Each service is started in its own greenthread. Please note that exceptions and sys.exit() on the starting of a service are logged and the script will continue attempting to launch the rest of the services. """ import sys from oslo_log import log as logging import nova.conf from nova import config from nova.i18n import _LE, _LW from nova import objects from nova import service from nova import utils from nova.vnc import xvp_proxy CONF = nova.conf.CONF def main(): config.parse_args(sys.argv) logging.setup(CONF, "nova") LOG = logging.getLogger('nova.all') utils.monkey_patch() objects.register_all() launcher = service.process_launcher() # TODO(sdague): Remove in O LOG.warning(_LW('The nova-all entrypoint is deprecated and will ' 'be removed in a future release')) # nova-api for api in CONF.enabled_apis: try: should_use_ssl = api in CONF.enabled_ssl_apis server = service.WSGIService(api, use_ssl=should_use_ssl) launcher.launch_service(server, workers=server.workers or 1) except (Exception, SystemExit): LOG.exception(_LE('Failed to load %s-api'), api) for mod in [xvp_proxy]: try: launcher.launch_service(mod.get_wsgi_server()) except (Exception, SystemExit): LOG.exception(_LE('Failed to load %s'), mod.__name__) for binary in ['nova-compute', 'nova-network', 'nova-scheduler', 'nova-cert', 'nova-conductor']: # FIXME(sirp): Most service configs are defined in nova/service.py, but # conductor has set a new precedent of storing these configs # nova/<service>/api.py. # # We should update the existing services to use this new approach so we # don't have to treat conductor differently here. if binary == 'nova-conductor': topic = CONF.conductor.topic manager = CONF.conductor.manager else: topic = None manager = None try: launcher.launch_service(service.Service.create(binary=binary, topic=topic, manager=manager)) except (Exception, SystemExit): LOG.exception(_LE('Failed to load %s'), binary) launcher.wait()

commit_message:
conf: Attempt to resolve TODOs in scheduler.py

There are five options marked with TODOs:

* periodic_task_interval - negative values are valid, making the TODO
  invalid
* host_subset_size - code was in-place to prevent negative values, so
  replace this code with a min parameter
* isolated_images - removing this option requires a little bit of
  thought and would likely require a blueprint. Retain this for now.
* max_instances_per_host, attestation_auth_timeout,
  soft_affinity_weight_multiplier,
  soft_anti_affinity_weight_multiplier - support funky value ranges
  which, semantically speaking, shouldn't be allowed.  Start logging
  any "invalid" values.

Change-Id: I8871b628f0ab892830ceeede68db16948cb293c8

commit_message:
conf: Remove 'scheduler_json_config_location'

The code that parses this file does nothing with the contents. Time to
remove both the code and option.

Change-Id: I228349110f9a9551776b18fbf8729a59ac7f810d
Implements: bp centralize-config-options-ocata

Add is_cell0 helper method

This simplifies the task of checking if a CellMapping object is for
cell0 by adding a helper method.

Change-Id: I7e71ccfa0e1e6224cc807a2f27cd476ae705da99

commit_message:
Move wait_for_interface_status to waiters

This is to move wait_for_interface_status to waiters so it can
be used elsewhere. Besides, wait_for_interface_status returns
the detail of show_interface which is needed in testcases.

Change-Id: I3a8cee9cd344be295cb0cdef5930793403cc6bca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/73/396973/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def wait_for_interface_status(client, server, port_id, status): """Waits for an interface to reach a given status.""" body = (client.show_interface(server, port_id) ['interfaceAttachment']) interface_status = body['port_state'] start = int(time.time()) while(interface_status != status): time.sleep(client.build_interval) body = (client.show_interface(server, port_id) ['interfaceAttachment']) interface_status = body['port_state'] timed_out = int(time.time()) - start >= client.build_timeout if interface_status != status and timed_out: message = ('Interface %s failed to reach %s status ' '(current %s) within the required time (%s s).' % (port_id, status, interface_status, client.build_timeout)) raise lib_exc.TimeoutException(message) return body

commit_message:
Check volume and minimum disk sizes to create volume

Check minimum disk size before attempting to create a volume
from an image. Use the maximum between that value and the volume
size specified in the configuration.

Change-Id: I8e540de90b308877575816edb8305588b1fe6e17
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/29/399229/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from math import ceilimport subprocess if imageRef: image = self.compute_images_client.show_image(imageRef)['image'] if 'OS-EXT-IMG-SIZE:size' in image: img_size = ceil(image.get('OS-EXT-IMG-SIZE:size') / 100000000.0) else: img_size = 0 if 'minDisk' in image: min_disk = image.get('minDisk') else: min_disk = 0 size = max(size, img_size, min_disk)

commit_message:
Configure Keystone Fernet Keys

Provision the Keystone Fernet Token provider
by installing 2 keys with dynamic content
generated by python-tripleoclient.

Note that this only sets up the necessary keys to use fernet as a token
provider, however, this does not intend to set it up as the default
provider; This will be discussed and will come as part of another
commit.

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ic070d160b519b8637997dbde165dbf15275e0dfe
Change-Id: Iaa5499614417000c1b9ba42a776a50cb22c1bb30

commit_message:
Add subgraph execution support

Add -S option to support subgraph execution. This would allow a user
to pick which tasks to stop on.

Example:

fuel2 graph execute -S keystone-db:openstack-controller/1

will start with all keystone-db tasks and end at openstack-controller at
node-1

DocImpact

Change-Id: I42f9caf2e9c18072a2ae0447df2ba3500f687d5e
Closes-bug: 1612616
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient refs/changes/05/353005/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument('-S', '--subgraphs', type=str, nargs='+', required=False, help='List of subgraphs to execute' 'Format is: ' '[<start_task/[1-5,7]>]:[end_task/[2-3,5]]') parser.add_argument('-f', '--force', action="store_true", required=False, default=False, help='Force run all deployment tasks without ' 'skipping.') dry_run=args.dry_run, subgraphs=args.subgraphs, force=args.force

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-23 14:36:38.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/debug.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.middleware/commit/59ebc5f033b679f66e279293e914ad0c2f1629a6', 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I33ae2f79d3db240e053aa0e6938404969826efaf
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I33ae2f79d3db240e053aa0e6938404969826efaf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.middleware refs/changes/87/401287/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for (key, value) in resp.headers.items():
deleted_lines: import six for (key, value) in six.iteritems(resp.headers):

commit_message:
Add migrations for NICs and Bonds 'interface_properties'

* Add default bond_attributes and nic_attributes for upgrade 'releases' table
* Add upgrade and downgrade migrations for NICs from 'interface_properties'
  into 'attributes' and 'meta' fields and contrary.
* Add upgrade and downgrade migrations for Bonds from 'interface_properties'
  and 'bond_properties' fields into 'attributes' field and contrary.

Change-Id: Ib1b1ad55372fa1e7e67a51273ce237acb61a7201
Implements: blueprint nics-and-nodes-attributes-via-plugin

commit_message:
Fix Cinder multinode grenade job

JJB treats lists differently than single values in `node` properties.
This was causing no worker being registered for the Cinder multinode
grenade jobs. This commit switches from list notation in `node`
properties for gate-grenade-dsvm-cinder-multinode-* jobs.

Change-Id: I0382470bb666cbf7ed64e1427259dd96f1b06b5e

Update the high level description of the training to cover better the
current content and the directions we are taking.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/46/401246/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: We've designed a training program to share knowledge about the different ways of contributing to OpenStack like providing new features, writing documentation, participating in working groups, and so forth. The educational program is built on the principle of open collaboration and will teach the students how to find information and navigate the intricacies of the projects technical tools and social interactions in order to get their contributions accepted. The live one and a half day class is focusing on hands-on practice like the students can use a prepared development environment to learn how to test, prepare and upload new code snippets or documentation for review. The attendees are also given the opportunity to join a mentoring program to get further help and guidance on their journey to become an active and successful member of the OpenStack community.
deleted_lines: We've designed a training program to help professional developers negotiate this hurdle. It shows them how to ensure their bug fix or feature is accepted in the OpenStack project in a minimum amount of time. The educational program requires students to work on real-life bug fixes or new features during two days of real-life classes and online mentoring, until the work is accepted by OpenStack. The live two-day class teaches them to navigate the intricacies of the project's technical tools and social interactions. In a followup session, the students benefit from individual online sessions to help them resolve any remaining problems they might have.

commit_message:
Remove network-gateway element from image build

This element is for configuring a network gateway. TripleO is not using
that configuration mechanism (and hasn't for quite some time), as it
uses os-net-config to configure networking settings instead.

Change-Id: I321baa01e25c346a86d36618d519b7204e7dd39f

commit_message:
Revert changes to CephClusterFSID generation

This patch reverts the two commits listed below. There was a problem
with CephClusterFSID generation as it was created by the password
generation code in Mistral in Newton. However, this password generation
didn't work for upgrades as it didn't take into account upgrades and
passwords that were in use in an existing Heat stack.

This issue was resolved in I3ea6bbd0d9c5dd345b8a4a26a1788326e09d4209.
Now when a deployment plan is created, if there is an existing Heat
stack it takes the parameters from the Heat stack and uses those, rather
than regenerating. This change should also resolve the issue where the
CephClusterFSID was regenerated.

Revert "Generate CephClusterFSID for new stacks"
This reverts commit 20167e850a6bcb1fbb1bfa8cb030000600c3dc27.

Revert "Revert "Add CephClusterFSID to generated passwords""
This reverts commit ad64050485f79d2330c68b76a3f21b4c0d9a3e33.

Related-Bug: #1636555
Change-Id: I10b5613eda4bd47554a4f5e9f57218010b835fe7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/12/401212/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # CephX keys aren't random strings elif name.startswith("Ceph"): passwords[name] = create_cephx_key()

Drop *openstack/common* in flake8 exclude list

There is not this directory in debtcollector,so
we should drop it for improving searching efficiency.

commit_message:
Install yum-plugin-priorities on centos images

When installing from dlrn repos on centos, we need to respect the
repo priorities.  This is not needed on rhel, so it is added to the
centos-specific image file only.

Change-Id: Idd083a4bf6f4cf11c8f552c4ff9fea05a3c8b79f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/30/397330/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Tacker changes to xenial node

This patch will help devstack gate job in Tacker move to Xenial node.
Recenltly, several OpenStack projects use new version libraries which
are available  on Xenial. Tacker leverages these projects, therefore
it is necessary to change to Xenial node.

Change-Id: If9eebb0946951d47f8b8dec4996a20fdee0ecd0e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/80/400780/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Exception payload for error notification

This adds an ExceptionPayload class for error notification. It will be
used when there are errors to be notified to users.

Change-Id: I5ac1d3b5d2aa5de21fe6f2719ba26869c0fde1f5
partial-blueprint: generic-event
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/49/400649/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import testtools from senlin.common import exception as senlin_exc from senlin.objects.notifications import exception as exception_notification class TestExceptionPayload(testtools.TestCase): def test_create(self): ex = exception_notification.ExceptionPayload( module='fake_module', function='fake_function', exception='fake_exception', message='fake_message') self.assertEqual('fake_module', ex.module) self.assertEqual('fake_function', ex.function) self.assertEqual('fake_exception', ex.exception) self.assertEqual('fake_message', ex.message) def test_create_from_exception(self): ex = None try: {}['key'] except Exception: ex = senlin_exc.BadRequest(msg="It is really bad.") self.assertIsNotNone(ex) payload = exception_notification.ExceptionPayload.from_exception(ex) # 'senlin.tests.unit.objects.notifications.test_exception', self.assertEqual(self.__module__, payload.module) self.assertEqual('test_create_from_exception', payload.function) self.assertEqual('BadRequest', payload.exception) self.assertEqual('The request is malformed: It is really bad.', payload.message)

commit_message:
devstack: set neutron_defaults

Current VIFHandler drivers require several options to be set in
kuryr.conf. This patch updates devstack plugin to configure those
options before running kuryr-kubernetes.

Change-Id: I223f17f98ffe10eb89a38995142c7b699ade2fba
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/78/401078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Neutron defaults KURYR_NEUTRON_DEFAULT_PROJECT=demo KURYR_NEUTRON_DEFAULT_POD_SUBNET=${PRIVATE_SUBNET_NAME}

subject: Controller side of pods' port/VIF binding
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-25 22:12:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/commit/7a04fa247344dd1f88be3f5a86727e38ab8a789f', 'message': '[WIP] Pod/Port event processing

Change-Id: I1acfa052a530f06def4f7179945fac1687e1951a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-09 14:37:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/commit/cd2737c5a5a77575c807801422e85d9b107114ed', 'message': "Controller side of pods' port/VIF binding

This patch introduces VIFHandler that is used by Kuryr-Kubernetes
controller to perform port/VIF binding for Kubernetes pods.

VIFHandler monitors Kubernetes pod events and creates/removes Neutron
ports when necessary. It also translates Neutron data structures into
'os-vif' VIF objects which are then stored in Kubernetes pod
annotations for use by Kuryr-Kubernetes CNI driver.

Future patches will extend VIFHandler to use various modular plugins
to perform OpenStack-related operations (e.g. PortOperationsPlugin for
port operations, NetworkOperationsPlugin for network & subnet
operations, SecurityGroupOperationsPlugin for handling security groups
and ProjectOperationsPlugin to support multiple OpenStack
projects/tenants) to allow flexible configurations without duplicating
the event-handling functionality provided by VIFHandler.

Note that some of the VIFHandler methods are not covered by unit
tests. That is because those methods are intended to use the plugins
instead. Once the plugin framework and the corresponding plugins are
introduced the unit tests will be updated accordingly.

Note that this patch also introduces Neutron<->os-vif translation in
form of the 'kuryr_kubernetes.os_vif_util' module. Only the bare
minimum implementation is provided in this patch that should allow
running Kuryr-Kubernetes in the default DevStack configuration. Proper
'os_vif_util' implementation and unit tests will be provided in
subsequent patches.

Change-Id: I1acfa052a530f06def4f7179945fac1687e1951a
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

commit_message:
Controller side of pods' port/VIF binding

This patch introduces VIFHandler that is used by Kuryr-Kubernetes
controller to manage VIF annotation and related Neutron resources
which are used by CNI driver to enable pod networking.

Change-Id: I1acfa052a530f06def4f7179945fac1687e1951a
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

commit_message:
Element overcloud-agent replaces os-collect-config

The element overcloud-agent is a purely package driven replacement for
the tripleo-image-elements element os-collect-config.

All it does is install the python-heat-agent package and enable the
os-collect-config service.

The intention is for this element to be merged unused, then a change
to the tripleo-common/image-yaml will confirm that it is working as
expected.

This is part of the effort to deprecate the entire
tripleo-image-elements repo.

Change-Id: I1f3bb386660f36813515544dc73b1c5e08467553

commit_message:
devstack: move to k8s 1.4.6

In the patch I9abc0878612b97795c68c8d773e7a29e891d1a6f, I introduced
the configuration of CNI settings. However, that was not supported on
1.3.x, so a bump was necessary. This highlights the need for devstack
fullstack tests.

Change-Id: Id4391b6a13f330cf346bd9dc3de2b23ea4f9833c
Signed-off-by: Antoni S. Puimedon <asegurap@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Resolve tasks by role tags

This commit switching tasks resolution approach to the tags based one.
Tag - minimal unit what's necessary only for task resolution and can be
mapped to the node through the role interface only. Each role provides set
of tags in its 'tags' field and may be modified via role API. Tag may be
created separately via tag API, but, this tag can not be used unless it's
stuck to the role.

Change-Id: Icd78fd124997c8aafb07964eeb8e0f7dbb1b1cd2
Implements: blueprint role-decomposition
(cherry picked from commit 2b0242f64593be45e22f0f464bcbfe41492bb183)

subject: Fixes for race conditions in revert migration with SR-IOV
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 18:38:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b9e78eae8b2e13b36f8700240dcc15cdce3d220b', 'message': "Fixes for race conditions in revert migration with SR-IOV

Those races are intermittent and can be observed when stress testing revert
migration on instances with SR-IOV.

In ResourceTracker, make sure to delete migration records for isntances that
we are migrating.

In PciDevTracker, free_device() should free PCI devices based on device ID
(and ignore status).  Also, clean_usage() shouldn't free PCI devices that
migrating or revert migrating.

Change-Id: I08e5a4645690d77e8f2d786bcf63bfe5a8f4fa98

commit_message:
Fixes for race conditions in revert migration with SR-IOV

Those races are intermittent and can be observed when stress testing
revert migration on instances with SR-IOV.

In ResourceTracker, make sure to delete migration records for
instances that we are migrating.

Change-Id: I08e5a4645690d77e8f2d786bcf63bfe5a8f4fa98
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/65/339765/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(lbeliveau): This code is racy. It's possible that PCI devices # doesn't get claimed and allocated during prep_resize or # finish_resize because a particular instance hasn't been cleaned yet # in the self.tracked_instances. if instance['uuid'] in self.tracked_instances: self.tracked_instances.pop(instance['uuid']) self.pci_tracker.clean_usage(context, instances, migrations, orphans)

commit_message:
custom interfaces can be used in node_templates

Standard and Configure interfaces was hardcoded and custom interfaces could not be used.

tosca_template.py: First the custom interface definitions are needed to be read
nodetemplate.py: During interface validation valid interface names should be
    collected from node_type definition
    and valid operation names should be collected from node_type
    and interface_type definitions.
elements/interfaces.py: in node_templates interface name-type resolution
    should be done based on node_type definition
    and interface definition can be collected either from loaded extension
    definitions (TOSCA_DEF) or loaded custom definitions (custom_def)

See added test cases for examples.

Change-Id: I6b324e3679b3a5d07b40a641b8c1e81983159b36
Closes-Bug: #1640098
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tosca-parser refs/changes/66/398966/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: INTERFACE_DEF_RESERVED_WORDS = ['type', 'inputs', 'derived_from', 'version', 'description'] for name, value in ifaces.items(): if name in (LIFECYCLE, LIFECYCLE_SHORTNAME): self._common_validate_field( value, InterfacesDef. interfaces_node_lifecycle_operations, 'interfaces') elif name in (CONFIGURE, CONFIGURE_SHORTNAME): self._common_validate_field( value, InterfacesDef. interfaces_relationship_configure_operations, 'interfaces') elif name in self.type_definition.interfaces.keys(): self._common_validate_field( value, self._collect_custom_if_operations(name), 'interfaces') else: ExceptionCollector.appendException( UnknownFieldError( what='"interfaces" of template "%s"' % self.name, field=name)) def _collect_custom_if_operations(self, name): allowed_operations = [] nodetype_if_def = self.type_definition.interfaces[name] allowed_operations.extend(nodetype_if_def.keys()) if 'type' in nodetype_if_def: if_type = nodetype_if_def['type'] if if_type in self.type_definition.custom_def: if_type_def = self.type_definition.custom_def[if_type] else: if_type_def = self.type_definition.TOSCA_DEF[if_type] allowed_operations.extend(if_type_def.keys()) allowed_operations = [op for op in allowed_operations if op not in INTERFACE_DEF_RESERVED_WORDS] return allowed_operations
deleted_lines: for i in ifaces: for name, value in ifaces.items(): if name in (LIFECYCLE, LIFECYCLE_SHORTNAME): self._common_validate_field( value, InterfacesDef. interfaces_node_lifecycle_operations, 'interfaces') elif name in (CONFIGURE, CONFIGURE_SHORTNAME): self._common_validate_field( value, InterfacesDef. interfaces_relationship_configure_operations, 'interfaces') else: ExceptionCollector.appendException( UnknownFieldError( what='"interfaces" of template "%s"' % self.name, field=name))

commit_message:
Validate template requirements as list

Template requirements are required to be provided as a list.

Change-Id: I3d993c00bc892f63716357c973e3262564be9ad8
Related-Bug: 1641096

commit_message:
Remove mox from nova/tests/unit/cells/test_cells_manager.py(3)

Stop using mox in test_cells_manager.py in the following test cases:
- test_sync_instances
- test_service_get_by_compute_host
- test_get_host_uptime
- test_service_update
- test_proxy_rpc_to_manager
- test_task_log_get_all
- test_task_log_get_all_with_filters

Change-Id: I43eaf4f9c09f4cb25107795bc6ef6900ee675ef5
Implements: blueprint remove-mox-newton

commit_message:
Remove mox from nova/tests/unit/cells/test_cells_manager.py

Stop using mox in test_cells_manager.py in the following test cases:
- test_get_cell_info_for_neighbors
- test_post_start_hook_child_cell
- test_post_start_hook_middle_cell
- test_update_our_parents

Implements: blueprint remove-mox-newton

Change-Id: I9ffc3d21620703957d91b1d169f2be2555ea2f9a

commit_message:
Remove mox from nova/tests/unit/cells/test_cells_manager.py(2)

Stop using mox in test_cells_manager.py in the following test cases:
- test_run_compute_api_method
- test_instance_update_at_top
- test_instance_destroy_at_top
- test_instance_delete_everywhere
- test_instance_fault_create_at_top
- test_bw_usage_update_at_top
- test_build_instances

Change-Id: Ia42bf5bd0cab68420454ad001fec67a5b1dcc6a8
Implements: blueprint remove-mox-newton

commit_message:
Add user and project domains to ironic context

This change also removes most of the logic from ironic's
RequestContext to reuse the oslo_context as much as possible.
Usage of domain_id and domain_name in policy files is deprecated
and their support will be removed in the Pike release. domain_id
field was removed from the context class completely, domain_name
value now mathces the oslo_context expectations.

ContextHook is changed too so as not to duplicate from_environ
functional from oslo_context.

to_dict method left as is, so that we don't break an older service
receiving the context over RPC. It will be changed in Pike release
to reuse the base oslo_context class' to_dict.

Closes-Bug: #1602081
Closes-Bug: #1627173
Closes-Bug: #1641972
Co-Authored-By: Jamie Lennox <jamielennox@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I9afe89bc6aee282ee4b7579d661e3fa83cc0ce84

commit_message:
indexer: list_metric(), skip sql if names is empty

If list_metrics is called with an empty list this creates a
sql request can will not match anything. Sqlachemey is complaining
about this when we batch measure for resource without metrics.

SAWarning: The IN-predicate on "metric.name" was invoked with an empty
sequence. This results in a contradiction, which nonetheless can be
expensive to evaluate.  Consider alternative strategies for improved
performance. 'strategies for improved performance.' % expr)

This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I9287c8d8ef1a5787f9245d78c197d870f959b0c6

commit_message:
Add PyScript module documentation

This adds some informations about the pyscripts module and provides
an example of a simple script.

Change-Id: I5d5f2ebfa78b2ef98dbe5a38e07797deea2ee9de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/28/388028/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================= PyScripts rating module ======================= The PyScripts module allows you to create your own rating module. Custom module example ===================== Price definitions ----------------- First, we need to define some pricing policies. .. code:: python # Price for each flavor. These are equivalent to hashmap field mappings. flavors = { 'm1.micro': decimal.Decimal(0.65), 'm1.nano': decimal.Decimal(0.35), 'm1.large': decimal.Decimal(2.67) } # Price per MB / GB for images and volumes. These are equivalent to # hashmap service mappings. image_mb_price = decimal.Decimal(0.002) volume_gb_price = decimal.Decimal(0.35) Price calculation functions --------------------------- .. code:: python # These functions return the price of a service usage on a collect period. # The price is always equivalent to (price_per_unit * qty). def get_compute_price(item): if not item['desc']['flavor'] in flavors: return 0 else: # The qty of an instance is always 1 return flavors[item['desc']['flavor']] def get_image_price(item): if not item['vol']['qty']: return 0 else: # Converting Bytes to MebiBytes return (item['vol']['qty'] / 1048576) * image_mb_price def get_volume_price(item): if not item['vol']['qty']: return 0 else: return item['vol']['qty'] * volume_gb_price # Mapping each service to its price calculation function services = { 'compute': get_compute_price, 'volume': get_volume_price, 'image': get_image_price } Processing the data ------------------- .. code:: python def process(data): # data is a list of dictionaries containing a "usage" and a # "period" field for d in data: usage = d['usage'] for service_name, service_data in usage.items(): # Do not calculate the price if the service has no # price calculation function if service_name in services.keys(): # A service can have several items. For example, # each running instance is an item of the compute service for item in service_data: item['rating'] = {'price': services[service_name](item)} return data # data will be passed as a global variable to the script data = process(data) Using your Script for rating ============================ Enabling the PyScripts module ----------------------------- To use you script for rating, you will need to enable the pyscripts module .. code:: raw $ cloudkitty module-enable -n pyscripts +-----------+---------+ | Module | Enabled | +-----------+---------+ | pyscripts | True | +-----------+---------+ Adding the script to CloudKitty ------------------------------- Create the script and specify its name. .. code:: raw $ cloudkitty pyscripts-script-create -n my_awesome_script -f script.py +-----------+----------------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +-----------+----------------------------------------------+ | checksum | 7650349ba3a913cef526dfb953575042ec3332e1 | | data | from __future__ import print_function | | | from cloudkitty import rating | | | | | | import decimal | | | | | | {...} | | | | | | data = process(data) | | | | | name | my_awesome_script | | script_id | 93de054f-9d6f-40b0-8e4f-9b8fee8cad04 | +-----------+----------------------------------------------+

subject: Correctly return exit code from stop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-10 10:56:24.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/51682e042347105eeebd1956905275680127eb77', 'message': 'Correctly return exit code from stop

Panicking and returning non-success on stop often leads to resource
becoming unmanaged on that node.

Before we called get_status to verify that RabbitMQ is dead. But
sometimes it returns error even though RabbitMQ is not running. There
is no reason to call it - we will just verify that there is no beam

Closes-Bug: #1626933
Change-Id: Iaeebc4fe3d29d06f8f94dfbb676cd30cf090f415
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly return exit code from stop

Panicking and returning non-success on stop often leads to resource
becoming unmanaged on that node.

Before we called get_status to verify that RabbitMQ is dead. But
sometimes it returns error even though RabbitMQ is not running. There
is no reason to call it - we will just verify that there is no beam
process running.

Closes-Bug: #1626933
Change-Id: Iaeebc4fe3d29d06f8f94dfbb676cd30cf090f415
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/12/384412/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ocf_log info "${LH} cannot find any processes matching the ${service_name}, considering target process to be already dead" return 0 return $? return $OCF_SUCCESS ocf_log info "${LH} RMQ-runtime (beam) not running." ocf_log info "${LH} action end." return $OCF_SUCCESS
deleted_lines: ocf_log err "${LH} cannot find any processes matching the ${service_name}!" return 2 fi # Return the actual status get_status if [ $? -ne 0 ] ; then return $OCF_SUCCESS return $OCF_ERR_GENERIC # Fail early without additional rabbitmqctl invocations # Ensure the actual status to be returned get_status if [ $? -eq $OCF_NOT_RUNNING ] ; then ocf_log info "${LH} RMQ-runtime (beam) not running." ocf_log info "${LH} action end." return $OCF_SUCCESS else ocf_log err "RMQ-runtime (beam) couldn't be stopped and will likely became unmanaged. Take care of it manually!" ocf_log info "${LH} action end." exit $OCF_ERR_GENERIC fi

commit_message:
libvirt: clean serial listen addr to always deal with string

When the MigrateData objects have been introduced the field
'serial_listen_addr' could not exist on compute nodes which have not
been upgraded so an utility method has been introduced to verify if
the field is set or return None. Now we should never be in the case
where the field is not set and we do not want to deal with cases where
that field could have been set to None or an empty string. This commit
clean the code to always use an empty string.

Change-Id: Ib3b2d96dc9063ad2e04bc9d70b3aa01de6db5158

commit_message:
Fix the gate

This patch includes two backport patches, which make the gate green and
possible to merge.

Remove the disable of ipv6 in gate

Disable ipv6 will lose the vm

Closes-Bug: #1643858
(cherry picked from commit 05a458a73963f1e08fcf7f27a5dae70de6a0e224)

Update Percona repo to current release

The Percona Repo was updated on the 14th November to version 0.1-4
this commit updates rpm based builds to reflect that change.

Closes-Bug: #1643867
(cherry picked from commit 673700618d1a131b17440c6a70a4f17351f2aba3)

Change-Id: I7316d013d9281946c1c566279cd64ecbe6b67d37

commit_message:
Removed check for KEYSTONE_CATALOG_BACKEND from trove plugin

Devstack has removed KEYSTONE_CATALOG_BACKEND from it's
repo: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391380

Due to above change gate tests are failing, we should
remove it from trove plugin as well. Refer below for
it's deprecation and removal:-
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-February/086272.html

Closes-Bug: #1644085
Change-Id: I1c2024f629375a03bcb40fb9ee98c853ed52d53b

commit_message:
validation_output.py: Provided output for ansible debug module.

- prints both variables and messages provided to the module
- template for printing debug module results created
- output contains module name, host and the result

Change-Id: I5854256542951d09bd48fa0e9415b90fd67abce8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/77/397177/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DEBUG_TEMPLATE = """\ Task: Debug Host: {} {} """ # Print the result of debug module if (('invocation' in results.keys()) and ('module_name' in results['invocation'].keys())): if ((results['invocation']['module_name'] == 'debug') and ('module_args' in results['invocation'].keys())): output = "" # Variable and its value if 'var' in results['invocation']['module_args'].keys(): variable = results['invocation']['module_args']['var'] value = results[variable] output = str(variable) + ": " + str(value) # Debug message elif 'msg' in results['invocation']['module_args'].keys(): output = "Message: " output += results['invocation']['module_args']['msg'] print(DEBUG_TEMPLATE.format(host_name, output))

commit_message:
Remove the 'MANIFEST.in'

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Ief94940857acd105db69c687900886a1b0c13f2b

commit_message:
Engine support for profile-create2

This patch adds support to profile create v2 in engine layer.

Change-Id: I2d2d4dd47b7263e6fd3c7b14155ad4078a3d0adc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/75/400075/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_profile_create2_default(self): self._setup_fakes() body = vorp.ProfileCreateRequestBody(name='p-1', spec=self.spec) req = vorp.ProfileCreateRequest(profile=body) result = self.eng.profile_create2(self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual('p-1', result['name']) self.assertEqual('TestProfile-1.0', result['type']) self.assertEqual(self.spec, result['spec']) self.assertIsNone(result['updated_at']) self.assertIsNotNone(result['created_at']) self.assertIsNotNone(result['id']) @mock.patch.object(po.Profile, 'get_by_name') def test_profile_create2_name_conflict(self, mock_get): cfg.CONF.set_override('name_unique', True, enforce_type=True) mock_get.return_value = mock.Mock() spec = { 'type': 'FakeProfile', 'version': '1.0', 'properties': { 'LIST': ['A', 'B'], 'MAP': {'KEY1': 11, 'KEY2': 12}, } } body = vorp.ProfileCreateRequestBody(name='FAKE_NAME', spec=spec) req = vorp.ProfileCreateRequest(profile=body) ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.profile_create2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: A profile named " "'FAKE_NAME' already exists.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) mock_get.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'FAKE_NAME') def test_profile_create2_type_not_found(self): # We skip the fakes setup, so we won't get the proper profile type spec = { 'type': 'FakeProfile', 'version': '1.0', 'properties': { 'LIST': ['A', 'B'], 'MAP': {'KEY1': 11, 'KEY2': 12}, } } body = vorp.ProfileCreateRequestBody(name='p-2', spec=spec) req = vorp.ProfileCreateRequest(profile=body) ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.profile_create2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual(exc.SpecValidationFailed, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The specified profile_type " "(FakeProfile-1.0) could not be found.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) def test_profile_create2_invalid_spec(self): # This test is for the profile object constructor which may throw # exceptions if the spec is invalid self._setup_fakes() self.spec['properties'] = {'KEY3': 'value3'} body = vorp.ProfileCreateRequestBody(name='foo', spec=self.spec) req = vorp.ProfileCreateRequest(profile=body) ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.profile_create2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual(exc.SpecValidationFailed, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("Unrecognizable spec item 'KEY3'", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) def test_profile_create2_failed_validation(self): self._setup_fakes() mock_validate = self.patchobject(fakes.TestProfile, 'validate') mock_validate.side_effect = exc.InvalidSpec(message='BOOM') body = vorp.ProfileCreateRequestBody(name='p-2', spec=self.spec) req = vorp.ProfileCreateRequest(profile=body) ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.profile_create2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual(exc.SpecValidationFailed, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual('BOOM', six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1]))

commit_message:
Remove NotificationPayloadBase class

The NotificationPayloadBase class is not useful if we model the
notification payloads carefully. It will create another barrier for
understanding the notification code if used.

Change-Id: I973a466aefac8332779cbbc9d221d4b2dd382c83

commit_message:
Add note with boot config image options

Adds options which allow specify image names for Ironic nodes boot
configuration: --deploy-kernel <name> and --deploy-ramdisk <name>.

Change-Id: I51d8d86b6ff7f95688599464324823d7c75da1f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/78/336078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: If you want use custom images for boot configuration, specify their names in ``--deploy-kernel`` and ``--deploy-ramdisk`` options.

commit_message:
Update Percona repo to current release

The Percona Repo was updated on the 14th November to version 0.1-4
this commit updates rpm based builds to reflect that change.

Closes-Bug: #1643867
Change-Id: I5787943bb2bc11408ca8e8cdd6d1997cbc8919f1
(cherry picked from commit 673700618d1a131b17440c6a70a4f17351f2aba3)

commit_message:
Registry support for notification classes

This adds register_notification class method to the base object registry
so that we can ensure notification classes are managed. Test cases are
not added because the logic will be exercised for all notification
classes we will add later.

Change-Id: Ie2b1aeb534e66d9ba6e5ab8bbc859c3b8bbfcb57
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/33/400033/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: notification_classes = [] @classmethod def register_notification(cls, notification_cls): """Register a class as concrete notification. This is used only to register concrete notification or payload classes. Do NOT register base classes intended for inheritance only. """ cls.register_if(False)(notification_cls) cls.notification_classes.append(notification_cls) return notification_cls

otherwise.

commit_message:
Composable Service Upgrades

Spec for decomposing the upgrades logic from per-node to per
service for Newton to Ocata upgrades

Change-Id: I2501577f09c02b77b2cf1dc8592b281ae590c038
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs refs/changes/16/392116/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================== Composable Service Upgrades =========================== TODO: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo In the Newton release tripleo delivered composable service deployments (IS there a spec? Can't find one at newton_specs_ ) which means that deployers can now specify a roles_data.yaml_ that determines which services are deployed on a given (now arbitrarily named) node. That is, there can no longer be any assumptions made about the node 'type' in reference to an expected or known list of services previously deployed on that given node or others of the same type. The current upgrades workflow_ is organised around the node *type* determining the order in which that given node and services provided therein are upgraded. The workflow dictates "swifts", before "controllers", before "cinders", before "computes", before "cephs". The reasons for this ordering are beyond the scope here and ultimately inconsequential since the important point to note is that for Newton to Ocata, we can no longer drive a node-type based workflow for upgrades. Consensus after the initial discussion during the Ocata design summit session_ was that: * Re-engineering the upgrades workflow for Newton to Ocata is necessary because 'composable roles' * We should start by moving the upgrades logic into the composable service manifests in the tripleo-heat-templates (i.e. into each service) * There is still a need for an over-arching workflow - albeit service rather than node oriented. * It is TBD what will drive that workflow. We will use whatever will be 'easier' for a first iteration, especially given the Ocata development time contraints. Problem Description =================== As explained in the introduction above, the current upgrades workflow_ can no longer work for composable service deployments. Right now the upgrade scripts are organised around and indeed targetted at specific nodes: the upgrade script for swifts_ is different to that for computes_ or for controllers (split across a number_ of_ steps_) cinders_ or cephs_. These scripts are invoked as part of a worfklow where each step is either a heat stack update or invocation of the upgrade-non-controller.sh_ script to execute the node specific upgrade script (delivered as one of the earlier steps in the workflow) on non controllers. One way to handle this problem is to decompose the upgrades logic from those monolithic per-node upgrade scripts into per-service upgrades logic. This should live in the tripleo-heat-templates puppet services_ manifests for each service. For the upgrade of a give service we need to express: * any pre-upgrade requirements (run a migration, stop a service, pin RPC) * any post upgrade (migrations, service starts/reload config) * any dependencies on other services (upgrade foo only after bar) If we organise the upgrade logic in this manner the idea is to gain the flexibility to combine this dynamically into the new upgrades workflow. Besides the per-service upgrades logic the worklow will also need to handle and provide for any deployment wide upgrades related operations such as unpin of the RPC version once all services are successfully running Ocata, or upgrading of services that aren't directly managed or configured by the tripleo deployment (like openvswitch as just one example), or even the delivery of a new kernel which will require a reboot on the given service node after all services have been upgraded. Proposed Change =============== The first step is to work out where to add upgrades related configuration to each service in the tripleo-heat-templates services_ manifests. The exact format will depend on what we end up using to drive the workflow. We could include them in the *outputs* as 'upgrade_config', like:: outputs: role_data: description: Role data for the Nova Compute service. value: service_name: nova_compute ... pre_upgrade_config: list_join: - '' - - "#!/bin/bash\n\n" - "crudini --set /etc/nova/nova.conf upgrade_levels compute $upgrade_level_nova_compute" - "nova-manage db sync" - "yum install python-zaqarclient" post_upgrade_config: ... We would then need to combine the upgrades config from each service making sure we can enforce service ordering where this is needed (keystone before nova, for example). The details of the workflow itself, and in particular whether this will be driven by a mistral worfklow for example are still TBD. Hopefully this spec is a first step at facilitating that discussion. One other point of note that was brought up in the Ocata design summit session_ and which should factor into the design here is that operators may wish to run the upgrade in stages rather than all at once. It could still be the case that the new workflow can differentiate between 'controlplane' vs 'non-controlplane' services. The operator could then upgrade controlplance services as one stand-alone upgrade step and then later start to roll out the upgrade of non-controlplane services. Even then the operator may wish to only upgrade some number of nodes running non-controlplane service. For example upgrade 10 nova-compute nodes at a time. Alternatives ------------ One alternative is to have a stand-alone upgrades workflow driven by ansible. Some early work and prototyping was done as well as a (linked from the Ocata design summit session_). Ultimately there was resistance to adopting another external tool for the workflow. Security Impact --------------- Other End User Impact --------------------- Performance Impact ------------------ Other Deployer Impact --------------------- Developer Impact ---------------- Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: marios, shardy, Other contributors: Work Items ---------- * Decompose the upgrades logic into each service manifest in the tht * Design a workflow that incorporates migrations, the per-service upgrade scripts and any deployment wide upgrades operations. * Decide how this workflow is to be invoked (mistral? puppet? bash?) * profit! Dependencies ============ Testing ======= Documentation Impact ==================== References ========== .. _newton_specs: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-specs/tree/master/specs/newton .. _roles_data.yaml: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/78500bc2e606bd1f80e05d86bf7da4d1d27f77b1/roles_data.yaml .. _workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tripleo-docs/post_deployment/upgrade.html .. _session: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ocata-tripleo-upgrades .. _swifts: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/newton/extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_object_storage.sh .. _computes: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/newton/extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_compute.sh .. _number: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/newton/extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh .. _of: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/newton/extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_2.sh .. _steps: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/newton/extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_3.sh .. _cinders: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/newton/extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_block_storage.sh .. _cephs: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/newton/extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_ceph_storage.sh .. _upgrade-non-controller.sh: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/01b68d0b0cdbd0323b7f006fbda616c12cbf90af/scripts/upgrade-non-controller.sh .. _services: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/tree/master/puppet/services
